articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's exports fell 8.8% in August year-on-year, while imports contracted 7.3%, customs data showed on Thursday, increasing pressure on the country's vast manufacturing sector as demand sags at home and abroad.
articles.title: China's August exports, imports fall less than expected

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: The U.S. Commerce Department should end all technology exports to Huawei and China's top semiconductor firm following the discovery of new chips in Huawei phones that may violate trade restrictions, the chair of the House of Representatives' committee on China said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US lawmaker calls for ending Huawei, SMIC exports after chip breakthrough

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Oil prices edged higher on Thursday, after industry data showed U.S. crude oil inventories were expected to have fallen last week, signaling tightening supplies on top of extended production cuts in Saudi Arabia and Russia.
articles.title: Oil prices edge up on anticipated US crude stock draw

articles.author: Ron Bousso, Marwa Rashad, Sudarshan Varadhan
articles.description: Shell considered shutting its flagship Prelude liquefied natural gas facility off Australia for a year to fix issues that have plagued its operations, but instead opted for shorter maintenance period to allow it to capture strong gas demand, three industry sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Shell ditched major works on giant LNG facility in favour of quick fix -sources

articles.author: Sarupya Ganguly
articles.description: The dollar's strength will be difficult to overcome for most major currencies by year-end, according to a Reuters poll of forex strategists who said the risks to their greenback outlook were skewed to the upside.
articles.title: Dollar to stay bright this year before fading in 2024, analysts say: Reuters poll

articles.author: Vivek Mishra, Vuyani Ndaba
articles.description: Emerging market currencies will struggle to reclaim the ground lost this year, as high U.S. Treasury yields and safe-haven demand amid a slowing Chinese economy keeps the dollar ascendant, a Reuters poll of FX analysts found.
articles.title: EM currencies face uphill battle as dollar's supremacy continues: Reuters poll

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nichola Groom
articles.description: The U.S. Interior Department on Wednesday said it would cancel oil and gas leases in a federal wildlife refuge that were bought by an Alaska state development agency in the final days of former President Donald Trump's administration.
articles.title: US to cancel Alaska oil, gas leases issued under Trump

articles.author: Tetsushi Kajimoto, Leika Kihara
articles.description: Policymakers in Tokyo believe China's deepening economic woes could hit Japan's fragile recovery, especially if Beijing fails to shore up demand with meaningful stimulus, potentially delaying an exit from ultra-loose monetary policy.
articles.title: China's economic gloom hangs over Japan's long-awaited recovery

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia said a strip-search of women at Qatar's main airport in 2020 played a part in its decision this year to stop Qatar Airways from selling more flights to Australia, denying it was acting due to pressure from rival Qantas Airways.
articles.title: Australia says Qatar strip-searches of women in 2020 a factor in blocking extra flights

articles.author: Byron Kaye
articles.description: At a beachfront park in Brisbane's north, suspended Australian doctor William Bay told a gathering that an upcoming referendum to recognise the country's first inhabitants and enshrine an Indigenous advisory body in the constitution would "open a gateway to unending tyranny and lawlessness".
articles.title: Australia's Indigenous Voice referendum faces misinformation linked to COVID influencers
